news-item.title: Bloomberg: Deutsche Bank Mulls IPO Role In Chinese Firm Amid Hiring Probe
news-item.text: (RTTNews) - Amid regulatory probe into its hiring practices in Asia, German lender Deutsche Bank AG (DB) is reconsidering on the work for the initial public offering of China General Nuclear Power Group, Bloomberg reported, quoting three people with knowledge of the matter. The lender employs the daughter of Shenzhen-based China General Nuclear's chairman He Yu and has helped the Chinese firm for the IPO for around nine months. The company had started working for China General Nuclear before employing the chairman's daughter. Late last year, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission requested the company to provide information on its hiring practices. No allegations of wrongdoing have been made. Last year, the U.S. had opened a criminal investigation into whether JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) violated anti-bribery laws by giving jobs to children of prominent people in China. Since that probe, JPM reportedly dropped out of two share sales for Chinese firms. The stock settled up 1.3 percent on the Xetra on Friday at 32.31 euros.
